text: Tugaga Maulalo (died 1986) was a Western Samoan politician and judges. He served as a member of the Legislative Assembly from 1976 to 1979. ==Biography== A civil servant, Maulalo served as a clerk and administrative officer.The Pacific Islands Year Book, Volume 10, p106Pacific Islands Year Book, Volume 11, p106 He contested the Gaga'ifomauga No. 2 constituency in the 1976 elections, deafting Malaitai Magasiva by five votes.Samoan election results by constituency 1964–2016 Samoa Election Results Database He lost his seat in the 1979 elections, finishing fourth out of five candidates. He was subsequently appointed as a judge on the Land and Titles Court. He died at his home in 1986.Deaths Pacific Islands Monthly, December 1986, p57 ==References== Category:Samoan civil servants Category:Members of the Legislative Assembly of Samoa Category:Samoan judges Category:1986 deaths
title: Tugaga Maulalo
